pageContext.claim: “You look at Article II, you look at whatever you want to look at, I’m allowed to be very much involved....I have not purposely, and not from any legal standpoint because from a legal standpoint, I’m allowed to get totally involved. But I have, purposely, not gotten involved. But, you know, at some point I guess that could change.”
pageContext.analysis: Presidents do not have unfettered right to interfere with Justice Department investigations, unless they want to spark a constitutional crisis.
